oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Shibam: Town in Southern-Arabia
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: B&W, 14 min. A curious Swiss film, with poetic ambitions, focussing on the architecture of this city in the Hadhramaut of south Yemen. The architecture is that of "mud skyscrapers". The only social relations shown are in a market scene. No spoken soundtrack or other explanation. Probably filmed around 1950.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Jacob, Walter; Weber, Hanna
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Ethnographic and Anthropological Films - Egypt and Beyond
